page.title: 17HAYWOOD FARM
page.content: Haywood farm had no machinery as it was only a small holding so machinery and the tractor were borrowed from Mr Crosslands big farm. We made silage.Silage is when you do not make hay.Grass is{silage}when you cut the grass green and put mollases in it, it is a sort of treacle and that lasts for the winter.It smells revolting but the animals do not mind it. Long ago the pigs were given pig swill which was left over food or rubbish but now pigs are not given this because of disease. You also had to do{fencing and {walling.}The walling is made of grit stone. Keeping the animals in was a problem .{Water was a problem }as it had to be brought to the animals from the spring.{The spring was our water {supply.
